content.data: View Mode
image1158.gif
image1159.gif
There are two options in View Mode:
Part View
image373.gif
Part View is not available in the S2M Optimizer.

Pattern 
 View
image372.gif

This is the Default View when Optimizing. The Pattern View displays 
 the Patterns list in the sidebar and the selected Pattern and it's machining 
 in the Pattern/Part Display Area.
Pattern_View.png
This area displays your Sheet/Pattern layouts.

The lower Section is the Part List. The Parts 
 on the active sheet are listed in the lower section of the screen. There 
 are several columns of information which you can sort the list by clicking 
 on the column heading. A Part selected from either the Pattern are or 
 Part list area will cause that Part to be highlighted in both Views.
Right Click Menu
image76.gif

There is one option in the Sheet Display 
 Area right click menu.
Properties

General 
 Tab
image287.gif

When using an Optimization machine there 
 are ten main options in the General Tab:

Dimension Style -  You can 
			 control whether the output Pattern printouts Dimension Style 
			 is "Width x Length" or "Length x Width". 
 Dimension Type -  You can 
			 control if you want Dimensions to display on the Parts or 
			 in a Legend on the side of your printouts.

Dimension Style -  You can 
			 control whether the output Pattern printouts Dimension Style 
			 is "Width x Length" or "Length x Width". 
 Dimension Type -  You can 
			 control if you want Dimensions to display on the Parts or 
			 in a Legend on the side of your printouts.

image380.gif

Set 
			 Origin at Bottom Left Corner -  You can set the Origin 
			 at the Bottom Left corner on your printouts. 
 From 
			 Corner/From Center -  You can control if, when using 
			 the Zoom Window tool, whether the origin of the Zoom window 
			 begins From the Corner of where you pick or the Center. 
 Factor 
			 -  Determines the percentage the Scroll Wheel will Zoom 
			 the view In and Out. 
 Reverse 
			 Scroll Wheel Zoom Direction -  Determines which direction 
			 the Scroll Wheel Zooms In and Out.

Annotations 
 Tab
image288.gif

On the Annotations Tab there are seven main 
 options:

Font 
			 -  You can control the displayed Font. 
 Dimensions 
			 Horizontal Offset -  You can control the Horizontal 
			 Offset of your Dimensions. 
 Dimensions 
			 Vertical Offset -  You can control the Vertical Offset 
			 of your Dimensions. 
 Dimensions 
			 Text Height -  You can control the Text Height in your 
			 Dimensions. 
 Dimensions 
			 Tick Height -  You can control the Tick Height in your 
			 Dimensions. 
 Annotations 
			 Heading Text Height -  You can control the Text Height 
			 in the Heading Annotations. 
 Annotations 
			 Part Labels Text Height -  You can control the Text 
			 Height in your Part Labels (Labels here refers to the Text 
			 marking your Part on the Sheet not the Label Reports you Print.).
